meanings.definition: To speak or perform without preparation
meanings.sent1: During the talent show, Sarah was extemporising a funny story about her cat.
meanings.sent2: The comedian was extemporising jokes on stage, making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent3: While extemporising her speech, Lily accidentally mixed up her words, causing a funny moment.
meanings.sent4: His extemporising on the guitar was like a painter creating a masterpiece without a plan.
meanings.sent5: The actor's extemporising was so natural, it felt like he was speaking from the heart.

meanings.definition: To improvise or make up on the spot
meanings.sent1: The students were extemporising a skit for the school play during drama class.
meanings.sent2: When the power went out, Dad had to extemporise a way to cook dinner using a flashlight.
meanings.sent3: In a pinch, she had to extemporise a Halloween costume using only items from her closet.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to extemporise a new dish when he ran out of a key ingredient.
meanings.sent5: The team had to extemporise a plan when their original strategy failed during the game.
